data.title: Nice Setting, Average Food
data.text: We had lunch here on our first day in Santa Fe.  The setting is lovely and the food is OK.  Not quite average but not transcendent to very good, either.

data.title: great chile chowder, too much mayonaise on the Torta de Borrego
data.text: I had a chance to visit this very popular restaurant but found a few questions. THe torta de borrego was mainly mayonaise which killed it. THe chile chowder on the other hand was great.

data.title: Excellent food for reasonable price
data.text: I have eaten at La Plazuela at La Fonda  many times. The food is always excellent - lunch, dinner or late evening snack - and the bartender is generous!

data.title: Ok, but not great
data.text: This restaurant is attractive, but not anything special.  The service was ok.  The tacos were tasty.   The vegetarian tacos were unique.

data.title: Great Local Choice
data.text:
This is my go to place with friends or for date night.  The service is impeccable.  I have never waited for a table, but always make a reservation.  The restaurant is in the atrium of La Fonda Hotel.  I love the old colonial hotel feel.  

Prime rib on Friday or Saturday night is delicious.  Many local favorites as well such as chiles relleños.  Nicely priced wine and spirits list with good by the glass options.  Fun to order the table side guacamole.

The downside is parking, but that is everywhere on the plaza. When available, you can park in the hotel garage.

data.title: Average food but nice atmosphere
data.text:
The building is historic and gorgeous and the atmosphere of the restaurant is nice. My wife got the filet with enchiladas (she chose a mix of red and green chile toppings) and I got the chile rellenos. Have to say, the food was fine but just average. I have had better steak, enchiladas, and rellenos at other places. This would have been fine except you are paying premium prices for average food.

Probably would be a nice spot for lunch. I probably won't be going back here though.

data.title: so enjoyable
data.text: This lovely dining room at La Fonda Hotel was one of the highlights of our trip.  The room is very pretty, painted glass on several walls makes it bright and cheery, babbling fountain in the center of the room.  Service is prompt and attentive.  Get the guacamole!!  He, Emerson, makes it right at your table to your preference!  Food is fresh, locally sourced.  And don't skip the flan for dessert - to die for!

data.title: A must to visit and have Lunch or Dinner.
data.text:
I visited Santa Fe in late October on a beautiful Sommer day. This town is full of life and attractions. The atmosphere is wonderful ,Vendors who try to sell Indian jewelry,shops full of all kind of things and not to forget the Art on display.
I decided to try out the Restaurant at the La Fonda Hotel. This Hotel with all the different areas with shops and Bistro's is worth to visit. The Restaurant however is in the mittel of the Hotel area and set up in a nice Mexican Décor. The Lunch menu is very rich and provides many Food items to choose from. The prices are in the middle and upper region. Service was quick and the Server was very friendly and helpful.
The restaurant is very openly build with a beautiful ceiling and wood work,the fountain in the mittel provides coolness and a steady sound of running water. I recommend this restaurant ,good food, great wine list, relaxing atmosphere, a little pricy.
Enjoy your stay there and do not forget to visit the arcades with all the vendors.

data.title: Great Dining Experience
data.text: I loved this restaurant--had a nice breakfast here while visiting Santa Fe.  The food was delicious, and the service was perfect.  The dining room is beautiful--this is a nice spot to have a memorable meal.

data.title: Dining in Santa Fe
data.text: The place is charming, the service plentiful and the food outstanding! It is a must when in Santa Fe.

data.title: Delicious food and excellent service
data.text: While staying at la fonda hotel, we ate at the restaurant quite a few times and food was always great. It is usually very busy restaurant. Service was as usual very friendly but this seems to be very common here.

data.title: Great southwest breakfast
data.text: They have traditional breakfast, but I highly recommend the relleno and the southwest eggs. Service is efficient and the food is very good. Great room to just sit back and enjoy the meal.

data.title: Love this Place!!
data.text:
We love to eat here!! It is beautiful and the food is delicious every time! We really enjoy lunch here. With skylights and painted windows, a fountain and trees the atmosphere is Santa Fe magic!!  This time I had a pork torta sandwich and it was very delicious! My husband had tortilla soup and the presentation and soup was very good! Guacamole is made table side and the chips and salsa were fresh and good! 
Don't miss lunch or dinner at this Santa Fe classic!!

data.title: Recent visit
data.text: This is one of the best places for lunch or dinner in Santa Fe. The interior is striking, somewhat like a market, the meals are fairly priced and service is top  notch. This trip we had the chicken entree and shrimp fajitas. We enjoyed both and would add that the staff redid our salads when they were overly spicy without a hitch. The restaurant is centrally located in town in the La Fonda Hotel, always brimming with activity. It's just a happy place for a great meal. We will return for sure.

data.title: Great tradition New Mexican menu
data.text: We were looking for some tradition Northern New Mexican cuisine serving great Margaritas and La plazuela fit the bill.   Located in historic La Fonda hotel it had a charming style like a Mexican courtyard.    The pork tamales were fabulous and tableside guacamole was one of the best I've had.  I would definately recommend this one if you are shopping in the Old Plaza.

data.title: Great food, service and atmosphere!
data.text: Authentic southwestern cuisine, helpful and attentive staff, wonderful Santa Fe atmosphere.   Best tortilla soup ever.

data.title: Nice setting but ordinary food -overrated
data.text:
Naaah...other then a nice setting...food was overpriced and ordinary... had lunch and ordered new mex fare and also their own specialty for vegetarians..cashew cake..
service was okay..not outstanding... new mex fare...nope...several places closeby that are much better..like the Shed..or tomasitas or La choza...since we tried them all..
Once and one...just to say BTDT..would not repeat...

data.title: Great SW food on the Square
data.text: The restaurant is part of the La Fonda Hotel in the center of Santa Fe. The speciality SW selection was basic and the food was terrific, would surly return.

data.title: Beautiful courtyard
data.text: Didn't eat here but from walking through the La Fonda hotel, could tell that this restaurant is in a special setting. Beautiful courtyard with stained glass panels.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: During our trip to Santa Fe my wife and I dined at La Plazuela.  Our server, Angel, was outstanding and the vegetarian pasta dish and the salmon were excellent.  Great ingredients included what tasted like fresh-from-the-vine peas and Morel mushrooms.  The decor is also very nice, with a real outdoor feeling.
